perturbation.original_text: 11.1 The Company's holiday year runs from 1 January to 31 December (the Holiday Year). The Executive is entitled to 25 days' paid holiday in addition to the usual public or bank holidays in England) in every Holiday Year, to be taken at times convenient to the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.1 The Company's holiday year runs from 1 January to 31 December (the Holiday Year). The Executive is entitled to 25 days' paid holiday in addition to the usual public or bank holidays in England) in every Holiday Year, to be taken at times convenient to the Company. However, the executive is only entitled to use them if the company approved it beforehand.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity by restricting when the Executive can take the paid holiday, which goes against the text saying that 'the Executive is entitled to 25 days'.

perturbation.original_text: 15.1 The Appointment may be terminated by either party giving the other at least 12 months' notice in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.1 The Appointment may be terminated by either party giving the other at least 12 months' notice in writing. However, if the Company wishes to terminate the contract, it can do so with immediate effect.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation introduces an internal contradiction, where the 'appointment may be terminated by either party giving the other at least 12 months' notice' is contradicted by the Company's ability to terminate the contract with immediate effect. It is now unclear what the actual contractual obligation is.

perturbation.original_text: 14.2 Any Intellectual Property Rights created by the Executive or arising in the course of his employment or his performing his obligations under this Agreement shall belong to and vest in the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.2 Any Intellectual Property Rights created by the Executive or arising in the course of his employment or his performing his obligations under this Agreement shall belong to and vest in the Company. Unless if the IP Materials were created from hours outside of the Executive's working hours.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces ambiguity over ownership of intellectual property. The original definition clearly states that ALL IP created vests in the company. The added clause makes it unclear whether the company truly has ownership. This adds uncertainty regarding the actual ownership and the company's rights.
